replies.bodyText: If Android suspends everything when DecorView is invisible, I'm wondering if they might also do that for opacity 0 at some point..
replies.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText:
I dont think so...
As opacity is more of cosmetic property (which can be used to animate). It also means that the space will be acquired by the view even if it's not visible because it is present.
While invisibility (with reference to iOS framework) actually has potential to remove the object. (Like for e.g A Button when hidden is actually removed from view hierarchy)
replies.author: Ayyanchira

replies.bodyText: View.INVISIBLE is supposed to be like that: it makes it invisible without removing it from the layout (unlike what View.GONE does).
replies.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText: Yeah, alpha looks better, changed to that.
replies.author: vbabenkoru

InAppFragment improvements, delayed display

* Hide the webView instead of DecorView for compatibility with API 29+
* Show the dialog when the WebView is fully loaded, or after 500 ms, whichever happens earlier
